solutionCode:
coco HelloWorld

state persistent:
    myString String
    greet String

endpoint deployer Init!():
    mutate 'My String' -> HelloWorld.State.myString
    mutate 'Hello World' -> HelloWorld.State.greet

tasks.description: Create a persistent state variable called greet and then assign it an initial value of 'Hello World'
tasks.test: async (logicDriver, expect) => { const greet = await logicDriver.persistentState.get('greet'); expect(greet).to.be.equal('Hello World');}
